metadata.title: DATA 2000 8-Hour Waiver-Qualifying Buprenorphine Training
metadata.description: A list of SAMHSA-supported CME courses that can help physicians qualify to prescribe buprenorphine in an office setting.

metadata.title: How To Fill Out Your NOI Form
metadata.description: A quick tutorial on how to fill out an NOI form for a buprenorphine waiver.

metadata.title: Opioid Prescribing Courses for Health Care Providers
metadata.description: SAMHSA-supported CME courses on prescribing opioids for chronic pain.

metadata.title: Providers’ Clinical Support System for Opioid Therapies (PCSS-O) Webinar Series
metadata.reference: American Society for Pain Management Nursing
metadata.description: A SAMHSA-supported series that addresses the current state of opioid use disorder, treatment issues for special populations, and assessment and treatment of patients.

metadata.title: Advisory: Sublingual and Transmucosal Buprenorphine for Opioid Use Disorder: Review and Update
metadata.description: Gives an overview of data on the use of sublingual and transmucosal buprenorphine for MAT for opioid use disorder.

metadata.title: Clinical Use of Extended-Release Injectable Naltrexone in the Treatment of Opioid Use Disorder: A Brief Guide
metadata.description: Offers guidance on the use of MAT with extended-release injectable naltrexone for the treatment of an opioid use disorder.

metadata.title: Federal Guidelines for Opioid Treatment Programs (PEP15-FEDGUIDEOTP)
metadata.description: Provides fact sheets and tools for media outreach and education on methadone and other MAT for opioid use disorders.

metadata.title: Innovative Practices in Medication-Assisted Treatment and Primary Care Coordination (Webinar)
metadata.description: Showcases two approaches to care in which MAT is provided and care for individuals with substance use disorders is integrated with regular medical care.

metadata.title: Medication-Assisted Treatment of Opioid Use Disorder Pocket Guide
metadata.description: Offers guidelines for MAT for opioid misuse at a glance.

metadata.title: Pharmacologic Guidelines for Treating Individuals With Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder and Co-Occurring Opioid Use Disorders
Pharmacologic Guidelines for Treating Individuals With Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder and Co-Occurring Opioid Use Disorders
metadata.description: Offers guidelines for MAT for individuals, particularly veterans, with post-traumatic stress disorder and co-occurring opioid use disorders.

metadata.title: TAP 30: Buprenorphine: A Guide for Nurses
metadata.description: Gives nurses information about screening, assessment, supervised withdrawal, and maintenance treatment with buprenorphine for MAT for opioids.

metadata.title: TIP 40: Clinical Guidelines for the Use of Buprenorphine in the Treatment of Opioid Addiction
metadata.description: Offers clinicians information on medications for opioid use disorder treatment, including side effects, drug interactions, and take-home doses.

metadata.title: TIP 43: Medication-Assisted Treatment for Opioid Addiction in Opioid Treatment Programs
metadata.description: Gives a detailed description of MAT for addiction to opioids, and discusses screening, assessment, and administrative and ethical issues.

metadata.title: Adult Drug Courts and Medication-Assisted Treatment for Opioid Dependence: In Brief
metadata.description: Highlights the use of MAT for opioid use disorder, including methadone, buprenorphine, and naltrexone, and the use of MAT for drug court programs.

metadata.title: Follow Directions: How To Use Methadone Safely
metadata.description: Describes how to use methadone for the treatment of heroin or other opioid use disorders safely, and discusses methadone overdose and life-threatening side effects.

metadata.title: Methadone Treatment for Pregnant Women
metadata.description: Urges pregnant women with heroin or opioid prescription drug use disorders to seek methadone maintenance treatment.

metadata.title: Medication-Assisted Treatment for Opioid Addiction: Facts for Families and Friends
metadata.description: Describes opioid medications, their proper use and side effects, withdrawal symptoms, and how medications combine with counseling in the recovery process.

metadata.title: Medication-Assisted Treatment for the 21st Century: Community Education Kit
metadata.description: Includes tools for media outreach and for education and public relations efforts to reduce stigma and gain support within the community and treatment facilities.

metadata.title: Opioid Overdose Prevention Toolkit (Updated 2016)
metadata.description: Offers tools to develop policies and practices for first responders, treatment practitioners, and others to help prevent opioid-related overdoses and deaths.

metadata.title: Rights for Individuals on Medication-Assisted Treatment: Are you in Recovery? Know Your Rights
metadata.description: Explains patient rights and the federal laws that protect people receiving MAT for opioid use disorder.

metadata.title: The Facts about Naltrexone for Treatment of Opioid Addiction
metadata.description: Gives patients information on naltrexone and medication-assisted treatment for opioid addiction. Describes addiction and withdrawal, how naltrexone works, its proper use, its side effects, and how it fits with counseling in the recovery process.

metadata.title: Tips for Teens: The Truth About Heroin
metadata.description: Informs teens about the dangers of heroin, including short- and long-term health risks and ways the drug affects the brain.

metadata.title: Prison & Jail Medication-Assisted Treatment (MAT) Training Video
metadata.description: Focuses on groundbreaking MAT programs for people who are incarcerated in Massachusetts, Missouri, and Pennsylvania.

metadata.title: Opioid Overdose Prevention Toolkit (Updated 2016)
metadata.description: Offers tools to develop policies and practices for first responders, treatment practitioners, and others to help prevent opioid-related overdoses and deaths.

metadata.title: Easy to do Harm Reduction and Naloxone but Naltrexone is Another Cup of Tea (PDF & PPT)
metadata.description: Explores the role of discussion of opioid overdose and provision of naloxone in clinical practice and reviews evidence for the intervention.

metadata.title: Facts for Community Members
metadata.description: Describes the scope of the opioid overdose crisis and discusses strategies communities can implement to prevent overdose-related deaths.

metadata.title: Five Essential Steps for First Responders
metadata.description: Explains five essential steps first responders should take to reduce the number of deaths resulting from opioid overdoses.

metadata.title: Information for Prescribers
metadata.description: Presents clinical practices health care practitioners should follow in prescribing opioid analgesics and monitoring patients’ response.

categories.-fullname: Resources for Communities, Survivors, and Families

metadata.title: Recovering From Opioid Overdose – Resources for Overdose Survivors & Family Members
metadata.description: Offers people who have survived an opioid overdose and their families suggestions for how to find connections and a support network through the recovery process.

categories.-fullname: Resources for Communities, Survivors, and Families

metadata.title: Safety Advice for Patients & Family Members
metadata.description: Explains what opioids are, how to prevent overdose, what to do if an overdose is suspected, and how to administer naloxone.

metadata.title: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
metadata.description: Offers basic information about the opioid epidemic, associated risk factors, and overdose-related statistics.

metadata.title: National Institutes of Health, National Center for Biotechnical Information:
metadata.description: Offers evidence-based resources and databases of published literature on genomic, genetic, and biomedical research.

metadata.title: National Institute on Drug Abuse
metadata.description: Advances the science on the causes and consequences of drug use and addiction and applies that knowledge to improve individual and public health.

metadata.title: Knowledge Application Program (KAP)
metadata.description: SAMHSA’s CSAT online CEs for substance abuse treatment professionals to provide professional growth and the CE hours needed to maintain certification or licensure.

metadata.title: CME/CNE/CE – Substance Use in Adults and Adolescents: Screening, Brief Intervention, and Referral to Treatment (SBIRT)
metadata.description: SBIRT is an approach that delivers early intervention and treatment for people with substance use disorders.

metadata.title: Primary Care Providers Working in Mental Health Settings: Improving Health Status in Persons with Mental Illness
metadata.description: Informs providers about the unique aspects of behavioral health settings and opportunities to improve the whole health of people with serious mental illnesses.

metadata.title: TIP 45: Detoxification and Substance Abuse Treatment
metadata.description: Educates substance abuse counselors and clinicians about detoxification and withdrawal.

metadata.title: Transition to ICD-10: What It Entails and Why It’s Important to Behavioral Health Providers
metadata.description: Answers common questions about ICD-10 for mental health and substance abuse services practitioners who are making the transition to the new ICD-10 code sets.

metadata.title: Classification of Diseases
metadata.description: Explains the primary systems of classifying injuries, including suicides and self-inflicted injuries, so that injuries can be reported and compared uniformly.

metadata.title: Classification of Diseases, Functioning, and Disability, International Classification of Diseases, Tenth Revision, Clinical Modification (ICD-10-CM)
metadata.description: Provides access to ICD-10-CM, a clinical modification of the classification for morbidity purposes, and announces updates to the implementation and compliance schedule.

metadata.title: ICD-10-CM Official Guidelines for Coding and Reporting 2014
metadata.description: Provides required guidelines and additional instruction for coding and reporting using the ICD-10-CM, to be used with the ICD-10-CM published on the National Center for Health Statistics website.

metadata.title: Physician Quality Reporting System (PQRS): About PQRS
metadata.description: Describes the combination of incentive payments and payment adjustments used by CMS to promote reporting of quality information by eligible professionals.

metadata.title: PQRS Overview
metadata.description: Provides facts about the PQRS, which has been using incentive payments to encourage eligible health care professionals to report on specific quality measures.

metadata.title: Tips and Strategies for Billing for Mental Health Services in a Primary Care Setting
metadata.description: Provides tips for designing a billing strategy and improving billing success for mental health services.

metadata.title: TAP 32: Clinical Drug Testing in Primary Care
metadata.description: Provides guidance on implementing drug testing in the primary care setting; presents the mechanics of testing and the steps clinicians can take to prepare their staff.

metadata.title: TIP 35: Enhancing Motivation for Change in Substance Abuse Treatment
metadata.description: Presents guidelines for screening and assessing teens for alcohol abuse and drug abuse problems.

metadata.title: TIP 57: Trauma-Informed Care in Behavioral Health Services
metadata.description: Assists behavioral health professionals in understanding the impact and consequences of trauma on those who experience trauma.

metadata.title: Pharmacologic Guidelines for Treating Individuals With Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder and Co-Occurring Opioid Use Disorders (SMA12-4688)
metadata.description: Offers guidelines for MAT for individuals, particularly veterans, with post-traumatic stress disorder and co-occurring opioid use disorders.

metadata.title: SAMHSA-HRSA Center for Integrated Health Solutions
metadata.description: Offers tools and resources to promote the development of integrated primary and behavioral health services.

metadata.title: Screening Tools
metadata.description: Offers resources, screening forms, and screening tools for identification of mental health and substance use disorders in primary care and other health care settings.

metadata.title: Suicide Safe Mobile App
metadata.description: Equips health care practitioners with information and resources to integrate suicide prevention strategies into their practice and assess risk among their patients.

metadata.title: TIP 42: Substance Abuse Treatment for Persons With Co-Occurring Disorders
metadata.description: Provides substance abuse treatment providers with updated information and advances in treatment on co-occurring substance use and mental disorders.

metadata.title: CDC Guideline for Prescribing Opioids for Chronic Pain — United States, 2016
metadata.description: Provides recommendations for primary care clinicians who are prescribing opioids for chronic pain outside of active cancer treatment, palliative care, and end-of-life care.

metadata.title: Safe and Effective Opioid Prescribing for Chronic Pain
metadata.description: Offers practitioners essential education in how to safely and competently use opioids in the treatment of chronic pain. Sponsored by Boston University School of Medicine, with support from SAMHSA.

metadata.title: TIP 54: Managing Chronic Pain in Adults With or in Recovery From Substance Use Disorders
metadata.description: Equips clinicians with practical guidance and tools for treating chronic pain in adults with a history of substance use disorders.

metadata.title: Healthcare for People Who Use Drugs - How to Talk to the Doctor
metadata.description: Offers tips and examples for how people with substance use disorders can talk with their doctor to get the information and care they need. Produced by the LA Community Health Project with support from SAMHSA.

metadata.title: Faces and Voices of Recovery
metadata.description: Supports recovery community organizations and their communities in developing and sustaining a constituency of consequence. Supported in part by SAMHSA.

metadata.title: MARS Medication-assisted Recovery Services
Motivational Interviewing for Better Health Outcomes
metadata.description: Online PowerPoint-based training provides an overview of the principles and practice of Motivational Interviewing.

metadata.title: Recovery and Recovery Support
metadata.description: Provides information on recovery-oriented care and recovery support systems that help people with mental and/or substance use disorders manage their conditions successfully.

metadata.title: Recovery Support: Collaboration, Coordination, and Recovery Management
metadata.description: Examines the elements that contribute to long-term recovery and how advances have led to more effective systems of support.

metadata.title: SSI/SSDI Outreach, Access and Recovery (SOAR) Online Training
metadata.description: Trains case managers to assist individuals who are homeless or at risk for homelessness to apply for the Social Security Administration’s disability programs. A project of SAMHSA.

metadata.title: What Are Peer Recovery Support Services?
metadata.description: Explains peer recovery support services designed and delivered by people in recovery from alcohol and drug addiction.

metadata.title: Young People in Recovery
metadata.description: Aims to influence public policy, making it easier for youth to find and maintain their recovery from addiction. Supported in part by SAMHSA.

metadata.title: A Provider’s Introduction to Substance Abuse Treatment for Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Individuals
metadata.description: Informs clinicians and administrators about substance abuse treatment approaches that are sensitive to lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender patients.

metadata.title: American Indian and Alaska Native: Tribal Affairs
metadata.description: Provides national survey reports, agency and federal initiatives, and related behavioral health resources.

metadata.title: National American Indian and Alaska Native (AI & AN) Addiction Technology Transfer Center (ATTC)
metadata.description: Provides American Indians and Alaska Natives with access to high-quality, evidence-based, culturally appropriate, self-directed behavioral health services and recovery supports.

metadata.title: TIP 31: Screening and Assessing Adolescents for Substance Use Disorders
metadata.description: Presents guidelines for screening and assessing teens for alcohol abuse and drug abuse problems.

metadata.title: TIP 56: Addressing the Specific Behavioral Health Needs of Men
metadata.description: Addresses the specific treatment needs of adult men with substance use disorders, such as patterns of initiation of substance use and specific treatment issues and strategies.

metadata.title: TIP 59: Improving Cultural Competence
metadata.description: Assists professional care practitioners and administrators in understanding the role of culture in the delivery of substance abuse and mental health services.

metadata.title: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration, Medication-Assisted Treatment (SAMHSA MAT)
Addiction Technology Transfer Center Network (ATTC)
REMS@FDA (Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategies)
Providers’ Clinical Support System for Medication-Assisted Treatment (PCSS-MAT)
Medication for the Treatment of Alcohol Use Disorder: A Brief Guide
metadata.description: Summarizes approved medications for the treatment of alcohol abuse and discusses screening and patient assessment, treatment planning, and patient monitoring.

metadata.title: Medication for the Treatment of Alcohol Use Disorder: Pocket Guide
metadata.description: Summarizes approved medications for the treatment of alcohol abuse and discusses screening and patient assessment, treatment planning, and patient monitoring.

metadata.title: Alcohol, Tobacco, and Other Drugs (ATOD)
metadata.description: Get the facts about alcohol and the impact abusing alcohol can have on people.

metadata.title: Medication and Counseling Treatment
metadata.description: Medication-assisted treatment (MAT) is the use of medications with counseling and behavioral therapies to treat substance use disorders and prevent opioid overdose.

metadata.title: Naltrexone
metadata.description: Find information about naltrexone, a medication approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to treat alcohol use disorders.

metadata.title: Treatment for Substance Use Disorders - Alcohol
metadata.description: Learn about the different kinds of treatments and services that are effective in helping people with alcohol use disorders.

metadata.title: Underage Drinking: Myths vs. Facts. Pre-Teen Alcohol Prevention Brochure
metadata.description: Corrects common myths teens and pre-teens may hold about the prevalence of alcohol use and the effects of alcohol on the body and brain.

metadata.title: SAMHSA-HRSA Center for Integrated Health Solutions: Tobacco Cessation
metadata.description: Offers resources for tobacco cessation programs and related information.

metadata.title: Tips for Teens: The Truth About Tobacco
metadata.description: Offers resources for tobacco cessation programs and related information.

metadata.title: Tobacco
metadata.description: Provides the facts on the use of tobacco, including cigarettes, chewing tobacco, snuff, cigars, pipe tobacco, and electronic cigarettes.

metadata.title: Tobacco Use Cessation During Substance Abuse Treatment Counseling – SAMHSA Advisory, March 2011
metadata.description: Discusses screening and effective treatment approaches to quitting, including cessation medications, and practical and supportive counseling.

metadata.title: Treatments for Substance Use Disorders
metadata.description: Learn about the different kinds of treatments and services that are effective in helping people with substance use disorders, including tobacco.

metadata.title: FDA 101: Smoking Cessation Products
metadata.description: Provides consumers with a list of smoking cessation products that are regulated by the FDA.

metadata.title: Smoking Cessation Medications
metadata.description: A guide to medicines health care practitioners may prescribe to assist with smoking cessation.
